name: USA Alphabetically - Part B Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which is the largest city in Montana?
questions.explanation:
Billings.

	Billings is the county seat of Yellowstone County; its proximity to Yellowstone national park makes it a major tourist center.

questions.text: The completion of the Erie Canal in 1825 triggered the huge growth of which city, which is located at its western terminus?
questions.explanation:
Buffalo.

	The county seat of Erie County, Buffalo is the second largest city in New York State. The completion of the Erie Canal saw Buffalo grow from a small town into a large commerce center.

questions.text: The National Aquarium is located in which city?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore.

	Baltimore is the largest city in Maryland. The National Aquarium was opened in 1981 as part of the renovation of Baltimore's Inner Harbor.

questions.text: The University of Colorado is located in which city?
questions.explanation:
Boulder.

	The University of Colorado was established at Boulder in 1876. Blacksburg is the site of Virginia Tech; Berkeley is home to the University of California; and Indiana University is located in Bloomington.

Boston.

	Boston, the state capital of Massachusetts, has a number of nicknames, including "The Athens Of America" and "The Cradle Of Liberty". The city's love affair with baked beans led to the Beantown moniker.

questions.text: Which city is sometimes referred to as the "Family-Friendly Las Vegas"?
questions.explanation:
Branson.

	Located in Taney County in southern Missouri, Branson is a major tourist destination, with numerous live music venues, and attractions such as the Titanic Museum and Silver Dollar City.

questions.text: Which state capital lies on the banks of the Missouri River?
questions.explanation:
Bismarck.

	The capital of North Dakota, Bismarck was originally called Edwinton, but was renamed after the German Chancellor Otto von Bismarck in the hope of attracting German settlers to the town.

questions.text: Which city is sometimes known as the  "Magic City" and "Pittsburgh of the South"?
questions.explanation:
Birmingham.

	The county seat of Jefferson County, Alabama, Birmingham saw rapid industrial growth in the 20th century which led to the nicknames. In the 21st century, the city has become one of the largest banking centers in America.

questions.text: Which city in New England is home to the Barnum Museum?
questions.explanation:
Bridgeport.

	Bridgeport is situated in Fairfield County, Connecticut. P.T. Barnum housed his circus in the city during the winter off-season, with the Barnum Museum opening in 1936.

questions.text: Situated on the Mexican border, what is the southernmost city in Texas?
questions.explanation:
Brownsville.

	Brownsville, the county seat of Cameron County, lies across the Rio Grande from the Mexican city of Matamoros. During the American Civil War, it was used as a smuggling point for Confederate goods into Mexico.
